alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 4:20PM CDT until July 09 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Marion County in northwestern Alabama... Northern Lamar County in west central Alabama... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 420 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Haleyville to near Okolona, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Winfield, Haleyville, Vernon, Sulligent, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Detroit, Beaverton, Gu- Win, Weston, Blooming Grove, Lamar County Airport, Brinn, Lake Buttahatchee, Crews, Bedford and Bear Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
